body_html:
Note that this matrix has rank 3, and the eigenvector in question corresponds to 0 eigenvalue.

Also note that both 0.5,0.5,0.5,0.5 and -0.5,-0.5,-0.5,-0.5 are valid normalized eigenvectors.

So, from the description of the function it seems the behavior is correct. I agree that it would be less surprising to have more deterministic behavior. Maybe an additional constraint to always have first component of eigenvector be non-negative? cc @rmlarsen

body:
Note that this matrix has rank 3, and the eigenvector in question corresponds to 0 eigenvalue.

Also note that both 0.5,0.5,0.5,0.5 and -0.5,-0.5,-0.5,-0.5 are valid normalized eigenvectors.

So, from the description of the function it seems the behavior is correct. I agree that it would be less surprising to have more deterministic behavior. Maybe an additional constraint to always have first component of eigenvector be non-negative? cc @rmlarsen
